channel.title: new-json-structures on because there are just too many things to remember

item.title: jq getting interesting: lessons 7 through 9
item.description: Where were we? Lesson 7 Creating new structures Last time, we created a string from each of the outputs we were interested in using a combination of the pipe ( | ), the raw and compact flag and string interpolation with round braces: jq -cr '.Reservations[].Instances[] | "\(.InstanceId): \(.State.Name): \(.PrivateIpAddress)"' Perhaps we would like to create an array of the values. This is pretty simple because, in effect what we’re doing on the right hand side of the pipe ( | ) is to create a new structure.
